availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Campbell Hay (Clark County, Indiana, physician and court clerk.)

body.p: Clark County, Indiana, physician and court clerk. Indiana native. Son of John Hay. Married to Mary R. Liggett Hay in Clark County, Indiana, on October 16, 1834. Father of Florence Hay, John C. Hay, Charles D. Hay, Helen Hay, Lillias Hay, Henry B. Hay, and Caroline Hay. Physician in Clark County, Indiana, in 1850. Physician in Clark County in 1860. Clerk of the Clark Circuit Court in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Charlestown, p. 91A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Charlestown Township, p. 153.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Charlestown, p. 367B.
Indiana Marriages, 1811-2019, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Clark County Marriages, Film 001415852.
Lewis C. Baird, Baird's History of Clark County Indiana (Indianapolis: B. F. Bowen & Company, 1909), 419.
History of the Ohio Falls Cities and Their Counties, with Illustrations and Biographical Sketches, vol. II (Cleveland, OH: L. A. Williams & Co., 1882), 351.
"Dr Campbell Hay (1808-1888," Find A Grave, Memorial 10805977, accessed August 28, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10805977.
